strf_parameters.interpretation: Spatial scales (25.00, 25.00) on a 100×100 grid imply moderately smooth surfaces with medium blobs. Variance σ≈1.000 yields high-variance fluctuations. Anisotropy (1.00, 1.00) gives a isotropic footprint, while temporal scale 3.00 over 10 scenarios points to short-lived costs. Correlation footprint suggests roughly 5 distinguishable hotspots at any time.

cost_surface_gif.interpretation: Average gradient intensity is 0.07× the field's own scale, indicating very smooth surfaces. High-cost peaks average 1.0 per scenario with prominence ≈0.134. Hotspots cover 5.0% of the grid and show intermittent overlap. Peak locations shift by ~29.61 cells per step (fast-moving peaks), and gradients exhibit directional slope bias.

heatmap_gif.interpretation: Intensity spans [0.000, 1.000] with mean 0.463. Spatial variance averages 0.0164. Hotspots (95th percentile) occupy ~5.0% of cells and are semi-stable over time. Centroid drift of 11.39 cells per step indicates moderate drift of dominant regions.

histogram_gif.interpretation: Scenario costs average 0.463 (median 0.468) with σ=0.021 (CV=0.04). Distribution is left-skewed (skew=-0.61) with light tails (kurtosis=-0.96). Outliers beyond 3σ occur in 0.0% of scenarios. Later scenarios shift by 0.008 relative to early ones, signalling upward drift.

kde_gif.interpretation: KDE is unimodal with modes at 0.476. Density concentrates between 0.420 and 0.491, with tail mass of 93.8% outside ±1σ of the mean. Mode locations drift slightly as indicated by the GIF.

violin_gif.interpretation: Medians range from 0.414 to 0.506. IQR averages 0.257 (σ=0.054), indicating moderate spread with consistent spread across scenarios. Shape symmetry score 0.10 denotes mostly symmetric. Upper tails hold 51.0% of total tail mass, signalling balanced tails.
